Machine Types.val: Unsigned integer in the range of [0, 2^8 - 1]
Unsigned integer in the range of [0, 2^16 - 1]
Unsigned integer in the range of [0, 2^32 - 1]
Unsigned integer in the range of [0, 2^64 - 1]
Signed integer in the range of [-(2^7), 2^7 - 1]
Signed integer in the range of [-(2^15), 2^15 - 1]
Signed integer in the range of [[-(2^31), 2^31 - 1]
Signed integer in the range of [-(2^63), 2^63 - 1]

Machine-dependent Integer Types.val: Unsigned integer type with the same number of bits as the platform's pointer type.
Signed integer type with the same number of bits as the platform's pointer type.

Textual Types.val: A Unicode scalar value (i.e. a code point that is not a surrogate), represented as a 32-bit unsigned word in the 0x0000 to 0xD7FF or 0xE000 to 0x10FFFF range.
Unicode string, represented as an array of 8-bit unsigned bytes holding a sequence of UTF-8 code points.

Tuple Types.val: Tuple types and values are denoted by listing the types or values of their elements, respectively, in a parenthesized, comma-separated list.

Array and Slice Types.val: An array has a fixed size, and can be allocated on either the stack or the heap.
A slice is a 'view' into an array. It doesn't own the data it points to, it borrows it.
A dynamic or ‘growable’ array, implemented as a standard library type

Structure Types.val: The memory layout of a struct is undefined by default to allow for compiler optimizations like field reordering, but it can be fixed with the #[repr(...)] attribute.
Just like a structure type, except that the fields are anonymous.
Like a structure type, except that it has no fields. The one value constructed by the associated structure expression is the only value that inhabits such a type.

Enumerated Types.val: A nominal, heterogeneous disjoint union type, denoted by the name of an enum item.
Declares both the type and a number of variant constructors, each of which is independently named and takes an optional tuple of arguments.

Pointer Types.val: Point to memory owned by some other value.
Pointers without safety or liveness guarantees.
